name: Congressionally Directed Programs
objective: NASA Community Projects/NASA Special Projects are provided by Congress for specific projects or programs in such a manner that the allocation (a) circumvents a merit-based or competitive allocation process, (b) applies to a very limited number of individuals or entities or (c) otherwise curtails the ability of the Executive Branch to independently manage the agency budget.
beneficiary_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
applicant_types: Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description:
Est 50 Congressionally Directed Community Projects 
To be determined est value ($86.800)

authorizations.text: Pub. L. NASA Community Projects/NASA Special Projects, P.L. 118-42. NASA Community Projects/NASA Special Projects, E.O. 13457, FY 24 Community Projects.

rules_regulations: General and Special Conditions (Award Terms) 2 CFR 200 NASA Grant & Cooperative Agreement Manual Research Terms and Conditions
